result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Douglas L Anderson.  Attorney Will Davis for John D Rice in court for State of Wisconsin. DE still in inpatient treatment for injury. Parties requesting trial dates.

Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
Defendant's attorney shall have 10 days to file an Authorization and return signed bond form. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kaila D except only for professional purposes at the VA hospital. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

08:42 AM Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court on behalf of defendant.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
